question_text: An expenses is said to be revenue in nature if it
subject: accounts
explanation: This is a very correct option to the question asked. Preliminary or preoperative expenses is a good example. They are expended and have a very great contribution to the income generated.

options.answer: adds or contributes to the operating income of the business
necessitates the introduction of additional capital
reduces the capital of the business
adds to or improves the value of fixed assets

question_text: Determine wage expenses from the given information, wages outstanding at the beginning, wages paid during the period 15000 and wages outstanding of the period 2,000
subject: accounts

question_text: Which method of pricing can be used satisfactorily in either rising or falling price situation?
subject: accounts
explanation: An average method which accommodate all the prices and then divide (inform of mean) is well acceptable in either of the two situation.

question_text: Use the following information to answer this question.Club building   400,000Subscription prepaid  3,000Sport kits      150,000Bar creditors    85,000Subscription owing    32,000What is the club’s accumulated fund?
subject: accounts
explanation: Total asset less current liabilities400000 + 205000 + 150,000 + 32000– 85000– 3000 = 699000

question_text: What will be the number of shares to be issued to a subscriber who applied for 50,000 units.
subject: accounts
explanation: Allotment = 500,000 = 0.4 or 40%∴ Each subscriber would get 40% shares of what they applied for.∴ 50,000 x 0.4 = 20,000 units

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.Buhari and Osinbajo are in partnership with the following partnership agreement Buhari OsinbajoCapital 40, 000 70, 000 Salary 10, 000 15, 000 Interest on capital 5% 5% Profit/loss sharing ratio 40 60The net profit for the year ended is ₦80,000."Drawings are ₦80, 000 and ₦12, 000 for Buhari and Osinbajo respectively"What is Osinbajo share of profit?
subject: accounts

question_text: The major distinguishing element between the final account of a partnership and that of a sole trader is the
subject: accounts

question_text: Prime cost is one of the following
subject: accounts

options.answer: expenses which can be identified with an allocated to cost centers
aggregate direct material cost, direct labour cost and variable direct expenses
the cost taken into account in the production process whether direct or indirect
the cost of commodities supply to an undertaking

question_text: The accounting concept that allows the cost of kitchen cutlery to be expensed, though it can be used for more than one year is
subject: accounts
explanation: Materiality states that only items of material values are recorded e.g. the cost of a stapler should not be capitalized but expensed just as kitchen cutlery.

question_text: When the invoice of a customer is overcast, the supplier will send to him a
subject: accounts

question_text: Using LIFO method of stock valuation, analyze the issue quantities and their prices
subject: accounts
explanation: given that a maximum of 260 units can be taken from the last receipt, the balance of 440 units (700-260) would be issued at ₦1.00 which would be taken from the first materials received (100 units)

question_text: CR. DR.Sales ledger balance	9, 500Sales ledger balance	420Bought ledgers balance	6, 115Bought ledger balance	350Credit sales 82, 000Purchases journal	54, 700Discount allowed	450Discount received	200Cash refunded to customers (debtors)	120Purchases ledger balance	250Sales ledger balance 120 The amount brought down in the sales ledger control account would be
subject: accounts

question_text: The ledger entries to be made if cash sales is banked is debit
subject: accounts

question_text: In a bank reconciliation statement, Dishonoured cheques is added to
subject: accounts
explanation: dishonoured cheques are added to uncredited cheques just like standing order and bank charges.

options.answer: aggregate balanace as per cash book

question_text: Which of the following is a debit entry in debtors control account?
subject: accounts

question_text: Which of the following is not a proper form of the accounting equation
subject: accounts

options.answer: fixed assets + current assets  - liabilities = capital
fixed assests + current assests + liabilities = capital
fixed assets – liabilities + current assets = capital
fixed asset + current asset – capital = liabilities

question_text: The accounting convention that state that stock should be value that the lower of cost and net realized value is --------------- convention
subject: accounts

question_text: What does liquidity ratio measure?
subject: accounts
explanation: liquidity ratio attempt to measure the ability to meet up with current obligations e.g. current ratio which measures the current asset to current liabilities.

options.answer: measures operating efficiency of a company
measures the ability of a company to meet its current obligations.
measures the value of investments of a company
measures the financial leverage of a company

question_text: Derive the stock turnover period.(Average stock = 23,000. Cost of sales = 300,000 year = 365 days).
subject: accounts
explanation: Average stock / cost of sales x 365days.

question_text: The following accounting entries are made when bad debt is recovered
subject: accounts

options.answer: debit bad debts accounts and credit bad debt recovered account
debit debtors accounts and recovered account
debit bad debts recovered account and credit bad debts account
debit bad debts account and credit profit and loss account

question_text: One of the items listed below will not be found in a company’s memorandum and article of association. Which is it?
subject: accounts

question_text: The act of making necessary adjustment after comparing the actual cost with targeted cost is cost ----------------------------
subject: accounts

question_text: The following account are prepared when goods are sent to branch except
subject: accounts

question_text: The basis of accounting for public sector is
subject: accounts
explanation: This is the basis for recording in government accounting where revenue are recorded when cash is received.

question_text: If the partnership agreement does not specify how net profit is to be divided, the profit should be divided .
subject: accounts
explanation: profit or loss are expected to be share equally in the absence of any agreement

options.answer: in proportion of current account balances
in proportion of weighted average of capital

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.A business has three departments x, y and zYou are given the following information Selling and distribution expenses ₦5200 Rent for the year₦6000 Department turnover floor space in square metres X ₦60,000 80 Y ₦80,000 60 Z ₦100,000 60How much rent is apportioned to department Z?
subject: accounts

question_text: A sales for ₦2,570 was recorded in the sales day book as ₦2750. The error committed was
subject: accounts
explanation: This type of error deals directly with the wrong use of figures

question_text: Keeping records under single entry system has the advantage of
subject: accounts

question_text: Which of the following is true in public sector accounting? Cost of assets is
subject: accounts
explanation: In government account, assets are written off in their year of purchase.

options.answer: expensed in the year of purchase

question_text: Which of the following accounts is debited when a delivery van is sold for cash?
subject: accounts
explanation: Cash is received and expected to be debited going by the principles of double entry.

question_text: When shares are sold at more than the per value, they are said to have been issued at
subject: accounts

question_text: Calculate the total purchase of a business from the given information, cash purchases 3000; payments to creditors 54,000; creditors at the beginning 4000; creditors at the end 2,000
subject: accounts
explanation: Total purchases = credit purchases plus cash purchases i.e. ₦52000 + ₦3000 = ₦55,000

question_text: Which of the following is shown in the profit and loss appropriation account of a company
subject: accounts

question_text: The income and expenditure account of a club is the same as
subject: accounts
explanation: this is because the income and expenditure account just like the profit and loss account shows the income to ascertain surplus or deficit.

question_text: Goods stolen at the branch is debited to
subject: accounts

question_text: Specific principles, bases, conventions, rules and practices adopted by an enterprise in preparing and presenting financial statements are known as ---------------------
subject: accounts

question_text: Which of the following cannot be realized?
subject: accounts
explanation: Good will being an intangible asset cannot be seen or touched and are just believed to exist goodwill can only be valued to be a certain amount, the realizable value becomes a difficult task.

question_text: If a trail balance is in agreement, one of the statement is untrue
subject: accounts
explanation: agreement of trial balance does mean it is error free. Some errors might not be disclosed by mere agreement

options.answer: the accounting system is error free
equal debit entries and credit entries were recorded for each transaction
the debit and credit from the journal were posted to the accounts

question_text: Use the following information to answer this question.Club building   400,000Subscription prepaid  3,000Sport kits      150,000Bar creditors    85,000Subscription owing    32,000What is the club’s total liabilities
subject: accounts
explanation: i.e. creditors plus subscription in advance 85000 + 3000 = 88,000

question_text: If sales return is understated, it implies that ------------------------------ is overstated
subject: accounts
explanation: This is so because returns inwards are deducted from sales to ascertain the actual sales made after subtracting defected goods

question_text: Accounting information is used by investors and creditors of a company to predict
subject: accounts

options.answer: potential merger candidates for the company
appropriate remunerations for the company’s staff
future cash flows of the company
future tax payments of the company

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question:\(\begin{array}{c|c} \hline & \text{Dept A} & \text{Dept B} \\ \hline \text{Sales} & 180,000 & 150,000 \\ \hline \text{Cost of sales} & 79,000 & 85,000 \\ \hline \text{Expense} & 28,000 & 40, 000 \\ \end{array}\)How much is the gross profit for department A?
subject: accounts
explanation: gross profit is sales less cost of sales i.e. ₦180,000 – ₦79,000 = ₦101,000

question_text: An advantage of using accounting ratios is that
subject: accounts
explanation: Accounting ratios helps management in taking decision the totality of the activities in an organization

question_text: The loss made by a non profit making organization is called
subject: accounts
explanation: deficit in a non for profit making organization stands for loss and it is the excess of expenses over bar profit and other income.

question_text: If rent account is debited instead of rate account, the error committed is that of;
subject: accounts

question_text: Use the following information to answer this question.Provision for bad debt 1500Additional information1. Bad debt written off amount to 30002. Debtors balance as at the end of the year is 28,0003. Provision for bad debts stand at 10%How much is to be charged to profit and loss account as provision for bad debt?
subject: accounts
explanation: Being that debtors balance minus bad debt written off multiplied by 10% and subtracted from the initial provision28000 – 3000 = 25,000 X 10% = 2500:. 2500 – 1500 = 1,000 (increase in provisions)

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.A limited liability company has an authorized shares capital of 50 million split into 100 millions shares. 80million shares are offered for subscriptions at 60k per share in full on application. These have been fully subscribed on issueWhat is the nominal value of each share
subject: accounts

question_text: The interest of a petty cashier is ₦2450Expenses N Printing 420 Cleaning 250 Stamp and postage 175 How much was received to maintain the interest at the end of the month?
subject: accounts

question_text: The ware and tear of a fixed assets of a company which is chargeable to company’s financial statement is called ------------------------------
subject: accounts
explanation: Depreciation is the reduction in the service potential of an asset as a result of wear and tear.

question_text: To realize an asset means to
subject: accounts
explanation: realization means when assets are disposed for cash as at the time of dissolution

options.answer: open its account in the ledger
give it out as a collateral

question_text: The process of cost apportionment is carried out so that
subject: accounts
explanation: Cost apportionment is the sharing of commonly incurred expenses proportionately where two or more cost centres are involved

options.answer: cost units could gather overhead as they pass through cost centres
common costs are shared among cost centres

question_text: Preliminary expenses is an example of
subject: accounts
explanation: preliminary expenses are just like other asset but are unrealizable.

question_text: What is the ledger entry for sale of generator on credit to Patrick?
subject: accounts
explanation: Patrick is receiving and should be debited while generator account is giving

options.answer: credit sales account and debit Patrick’s account
credit generator account and debit cash account
credit sales account and debit cash account
credit generator account and debit Patrick’s account

question_text: Sai Baba made sales of ₦10,000 having computed his gross profit % to sales to be 20. His opening stock was ₦250 and ending stock is ₦200. Calculate his purchases.
subject: accounts
explanation: The gross profit percentage of sales would be20% x ₦10,000 = ₦2000If cost of sales + gross profit = ₦10,000 = ₦2000:. ₦8000 + ₦2000 = ₦10,000If cost of goods available for sales less closing stock = cost of sales:. ₦8200 + ₦200 = ₦8000Hence; cost of goods available for sale = opening stock + purchases:. ₦8200 = ₦250 + A = ₦8200 – ₦250=₦7950

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.Jejelaye Plc stock records for 2009 was given below:Jan 1    received    100 units   at         ₦1.00Jan 8    received    260 units   at         ₦1.05Jan 20   issued      700units   at       .........Feb 3    received    400 units  at         ₦1.15What will be the issued price of 700 units, using simple average method
subject: accounts
explanation: simple average method usually add up all receipt prices ahead of the issued material divided by 2

question_text: Capital reserves includes the following except
subject: accounts
explanation: general reserves is not a form of capital reserves. It is considered as revenue reserves

question_text: Which of the following is not a feature of accounting information?
subject: accounts
explanation: accounting information and report must be accurate, complete and timely. Money spent to obtain an information is not as important as how useful are those information in taking decisions.

question_text: The accounting concepts which assumes that business will continue to be in existence into the foresee ablefure is
subject: accounts
explanation: This concept is the only one among the listed that assumes that the business will continue to operate for an indefinitely long period of time.

question_text: The purpose of a trading account is to ascertain
subject: accounts
explanation: The trading account is primarily prepared to ascertain gross profit or loss.

question_text: A limited liability company has an authorized share capital of ₦50 million split into 100 million shares 80 million share was offered for subscription at 60k per share payable in full on application. These have been fully subscribed and issuedWhat is the nominal value of each share?
subject: accounts

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question:\(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Stock} & 11,250 \\ \hline \text{Debtors} & 18,750 \\ \hline \text{Creditors} & 3,750 \\ \hline \text{Bank} & 4,000 \\ \hline \text{Net profit} & 7,500 \\ \hline \text{Net} & 60,000 \\ \end{array}\)Determine the debtors collection period.
subject: accounts

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.Dangote acquired Dantata’s business for ₦350,000. The total asset work were ₦820,000 and liabilities amounted to ₦640,000The double entry to record the goodwill in the books is debt
subject: accounts
explanation: when there is excess of purchase consideration over net assets, the accounting entries is to debit goodwill account as the receiving account and credit purchase of business account as the giving account.

options.answer: purchase of business account and credit cash account
goodwill account and credit purchase of business account
cash account and credit goodwill account
goodwill account and credit cash account

question_text: Use the information below to answer this questionSegunOjo, didn’t keep her books on double principle. On 1st Jan, 2014, cash in hand was 850, bank overdraft 3500, debtor 15,500,stock 18,000, fittings 9,000 and creditors 12,700. As at Dec, 2014, cash in hand was 1200, cash at bank 2,500, debtors 10,000, stock 20,500, furnishing 4,000 and creditors 17,000Determine the closing capital 31/12/2014
subject: accounts

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question:\(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Raw materials Jan.} & 5,000 \\ \hline \text{Raw materials Dec.} & 5,800 \\ \hline \text{Purchase of raw materials} & 45,000 \\ \hline \text{Salary} & 61,000 \\ \hline \text{Factory lubricant} & 2,050 \\ \hline \text{plant depreciation} & 1,300 \\ \hline \text{Factory insurance} & 1,250 \\ \end{array}\)The prime cost for the company is
subject: accounts
explanation: The prime cost are direct cost,direct material cost, direct labour cost and direct expenses.Therefore:Raw materials (jan)5000Add purchases 45,000Less raw materials (dec) 5,800Cost of raw materials consume 44,200Prime cost 169,200

question_text: Use the information below to answer this question.Timo and Chris are computer engineers who went into partnership as Teachi and Co.
